entry.title: Oregon Dept. of Education releases statewide assessment data
entry.summary: Oct. 2, 2025 11:05 a.m. The Oregon Department of Education released the statewide 2023-24 assessment results for K-12 students. The results show areas of progress statewide as well as with many Douglas County school districts. The assessment results are for English Language Arts (ELA), Mathematics and Science. Overall, school districts in Douglas County showed improvements...

entry.title: UCC remembers deadly shooting with acts of service, moment of silence, 10 years later
entry.summary: WINCHESTER â€” Umpqua Community College's Chief Academic Officer Danielle Haskett greeted those gathered Wednesday around the memorial of the Oct. 1, 2015, deadly shooting at Umpqua Community College (UCC).

entry.title: Rep. Elmer and Rep. Skarlatos elected to House Republican leadership
entry.summary: Oct. 2, 2025 7:45 a.m. The Oregon House Republicans have chosen new leadership. Representative Lucetta Elmer, from McMinnville, was selected as the new House minority leader in a Wednesday night vote. Representative Alek Skarlatos from Winston was chosen as deputy leader. Elmer takes over for Rep. Christine Drazan, from Canby, who led the Caucus during...

entry.summary: Those visiting the Umpqua Valley's wine country often are there to sit and sip while taking in the views. Once a year, the Umpqua Velo Club (UVC) gives wine enthusiasts and cyclists a new way to enjoy the region's scenery:â€¦

entry.title: Roseburg VA Health Care System remains open despite shutdown
entry.summary: Oct. 2, 2025 7:35 a.m. With the recent federal government shutdown casting uncertainty on many things, the Roseburg VA Health Care System confirmed Wednesday that it remains open. All appointments and services will continue as normal and patients can make a new appointment by calling 541-440-1000. Find more information on impacted VA programs at this...

entry.title: Umpqua Community College marks tenth anniversary of 2015 shooting
entry.summary: Today marks 10 years since the tragic shooting at Umpqua Community College (UCC) in Roseburg. Eight students and one professor were killed that day. The college continues to support the families, friends and witnesses, with a memorial for the livesâ€¦

entry.title: Emigrant Fire containment grows, local management taking over
entry.summary: Oct. 1, 2025 2:40 p.m. The Emigrant Fire, burning south of Oakridge in portions of Douglas County, is now 51% contained according to the latest updates from the Rocky Mountain Complex Incident Management Team 1 on Wednesday. The lightning-caused fire has grown to 33,097 acres, , but thereâ€™s only 272 crew members left working the...

entry.summary: Oct. 1, 2025 2:40 p.m.Â The Rogue River-Siskiyou National Forest has decreased the fire danger level to moderate and reduced the Industrial Fire Precaution Level to level 1 as of Wednesday morning. The changes affect all five ranger districts across the forest, including portions of eastern Douglas County. Under IFPL I, fire precaution requirements remain...

entry.title: U.S. Postal Service holds hiring event, bolsters delivery team in Douglas County
entry.summary: The United States Postal Service (USPS) has delivered mail and packages across the country for 250 years. However, today the Roseburg Post Office has relied more on Amazon and other courier services to help get these goods to their destinations.

entry.title: Builder Sues Over Unfinished Senior Living Projects
entry.summary: A Sutherlin builder is suing the parent companies behind unfinished senior living projects in Roseburg and Creswell, claiming nearly $3 million in unpaid work. Dan Van Acker of Mars Construction alleges breach of contract and seeks foreclosure on the properties to recover costs.

entry.title: Roseburg Man Arrested on Felony Assault Charge
entry.summary: Roseburg Police arrested Justin Jones early Saturday on felony assault charges after he allegedly admitted to kicking a woman in the ribs. The victim reported difficulty breathing and feared broken ribs. Jones is held without bail at Douglas County Corrections.

entry.title: Roseburg Man Arrested for Felony Strangulation
entry.summary: A 50-year-old Roseburg man, Royce Morgan, was arrested Sunday for felony strangulation, assault, and menacing after allegedly choking a woman and threatening to kill her. He is being held without bail at Douglas County Corrections.

entry.title: Though Fall Is Here, Fire Season Is Not Over
entry.summary: Though fall has arrived, fire season is not over. ODF warns fuels remain dry, east winds elevate risk, and most of Oregon is still at moderate to high fire danger. Debris burning is prohibited until season-ending rains arrive.

entry.title: Restrictions Decrease for Public and Industry
entry.summary: DFPA has lowered fire restrictions: Public Use is now Level LOW and IFPL reduced to Level 1 across the Douglas District. Debris burning remains prohibited. More at www.dfpa.net or call (541) 672-6507.

entry.title: The Umpqua goes East: Melrose Vineyards begins partnership in Taiwan
entry.summary: Since the late 1800s, the Umpqua Valley has garnered a reputation as one of Oregonâ€™s premier wine regions, and possibly its oldest. Despite its popularity in the United States, Umpqua Valley wine is arguably not a world renowned product.
